page.title: 14Sports in Carnoustie.
page.content: Sailing is quite a popular sport in Carnoustie.There is a well-attended {sailing club,}where all sorts of dinghies race every Wednesday and most weekends.Fireballs make up the biggest dinghy class with most learners starting off in Mirrors or Westelevens The club often hosts national events such as the Osprey Championships. In the{Tayside Amateur Athletics {Club}there are about 87 runners.The annual fee is Â£6.00.Meetings are on Tuesdays and Wednesdays with younger runners training at different times from the older ones.The majority of the club's members are children. The{Carnoustie Cycling Club}has 15 members,2 of whom are girls.No-one is really in charge although there is a club chairman.The riders both race and tour often travelling as far as Glasgow.Racing facilities are needed.
